website_summaries.verdict: A premium, well-balanced matcha tea that's best enjoyed on its own.
pros: With its pleasant blend of earthy and sweet flavors, Encha matcha can be enjoyed without any added dairy or sweeteners
Encha is ceremonial-grade matcha, meaning it is ground from premium fresh leaves
Powder is super fine and dissolves easily in hot or cold water
cons: Sits at a significantly higher price point than comparable brands

customer_reviews.title: what a fun and expensive tasting comparison
customer_reviews.text: I decided to splurge in the top three organic Japanese ceremonial matcha before set my mind on one. Clearly Encha is my choice. Its color is the most pure and bright green. DoMatcha is a little darker. Ke love is a bit dull. Taste varied more. They all taste very smooth. But Encha has the thickest froth and tastes the most rich and delicate. DoMatcha ranks the second with a bit flatter body. Kenko is the most flat, a bit watery.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: IN SHOCK AT TINY SIZE!
customer_reviews.text: NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN???!!!!!! THIS IS TINY!!!! I’ll RE-WRITE MY REVIEW AFTER TRYING THIS. IT BETTER BE POTENT FOR THIS LITTLE AMOUNT is all I’m gonna say 1 MONTH LATER.... WHAT A JOKE! I totally feel like I got ripped off! Each serving size was so small I felt NO affect what so ever! So I ended up adding 3 servings per drink and I did like it but it lasted just 2-3 weeks & for &40 it’s NOT WORTH IT! The bag on the picture looks way bigger and when you get it... It’s the size of a small sandwich bag that’s half full. 🙄 Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Tellier

customer_reviews.title: VERY TINY PACK OF MATCHA.
customer_reviews.text: Highly upset!! I paid $23.95 for a pack of Matcha Green Tea Powder that is no bigger than my cell case. This is redicoulous. I understand that this is the most popular brand but no thanks. I'm better off buying a less popular brand which is 5 times the size of this tiny tiny pack. Disgusted!
customer_reviews.author: Yeah Right

customer_reviews.text: Delicious. As soon as I opened the bag, I got a whiff of this floral and sweet matcha. The company is based out of the Bay Area and they source their tea from Japan with is awesome. It's pretty pricey, but it's ceremonial grade quality and you can tell it's up to standard so I don't mind paying ~$50 for 60 g. I tried it hot and iced side by side and both offer very different, but fantastic teas. The hot one was smooth, creamy, and very balanced. The iced was a bit frothier because I shook it in a protein bottle shaker and it was definitely on the more floral side probably because it didn't hit hot water?
customer_reviews.author: Ed Medina

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this matcha, given the price I paid for it and how many other favorable reviews there are. However, when I got the package and excitedly made my first matcha latte, I noticed that after whisking for 30 seconds in ~170 degree water (my normal routine with matcha) there were still little chunks all throughout. It didn’t mix in. Then when I started drinking I noticed a bitterness that even cut through the creamer I use. Very disappointed and hoping I just got a bad batch because I don’t really have anything good to say about this product right now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: Clumps badly but good taste.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t get it to not clump. I know this stuff is supposed to be the best but it just doesn’t work for me. I tried dissolving in hot water and using an electric to make sure it mixes up well but it still doesn’t dissolve and leaves little clumps making it hard to drink. Also, my review was hidden due to the sensitivity filter which is a little suspicious since there’s nothing sensitive about my review. I will be checking to make sure it posted and if it’s reported I’ll resubmit it because fake ratings don’t help consumers.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Botanist

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Matcha
customer_reviews.text: I compared Encha to the Teavana matcha I bought and it is a much brighter green and much more finely ground. The flavor is good and it blends easily because of the fine quality. Nice packaging. Comes in resealable pouch inside of a box, with a wooden scoop. I would buy this matcha more often, but it is pricey. If you're looking for good quality and taste and cost isn't an issue, this is a good one to try. Photos shows Encha on left / Teavana on right.
customer_reviews.author: J. Benzaquen

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t care for the taste of this particular matcha brand. It tasted very weak compared to other brands I’ve purchased. Unfortunately this brand is a no for me... I even purchased it twice just to see if I just had a bad batch the first go round because it had so many awesome reviews. It was still the same :\
customer_reviews.author: Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Love this matcha
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this matcha. I enjoyed it all winter long mixed with a few warming spices and vanilla soy milk to form a matcha chai! With the warmer weather, I felt I would prefer a cold beverage. I now am making a matcha lemonade. It is delicious and perfect for a warm summer day. This matcha tea is top notch. When I ran out, I had some from another company (teapigs). The last was more bitter and after drinking it for a few days ( just one cup per day), my stomach started to hurt. I immediately reorder this brand and voila! no more digestive issues. I will continue to order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Annliz

customer_reviews.title: Great taste! Cheap compared to Starbucks teas.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased cheap matchas in the past so I never knew what a good matcha was like. I've drank the latte grade of Encha several times now and it tastes amazing by itself even w/o a milk. Compared to the cost of a single, much lower quality tea at a common store (like Starbucks), even the single-serving packets of ceremonial matcha are a great bang for the buck. I'm doing some tourism travel in about a month and plan to take some single-serving latter-grade packets with me instead of drinking cheap coffee at hotels. I've only had 2 servings of the ceremonial grade, so I'm not ready to comment yet.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Best Matcha
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this company and their tea. I have been drinking it for years and it is the best matcha I have ever tasted. It is clean and smooth and gives a great high quality energy. It drink it iced, hot and plain and hot and mixed with herbal tea and in latte form. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: shanna

customer_reviews.title: A great tasting matcha powder
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple matcha green tea powder and they are all good but this matcha green tea is by far my favorite and taste great. I used this product to make a green tea Frappuccino like Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Walters

customer_reviews.text: Ok. This stuff is expensive and you don’t get much. BUT it’s the best I’ve ever tasted. I don’t even have the proper tools nor skills, and I still managed to make a delicious latte. I purchased it because I read that this company triple test for heavy metals and whatever else seems to be in tea these days. I did the math and I’d spent more money getting a latte from blue bottle everyday ... so that’s how I justified the price
customer_reviews.author: Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Drank this matcha a few times, and after every time my stomach felt a bit off. I just chalked it up too not being used to the caffeine or something. However this morning I mixed it and literally threw up 5 minutes later out of no where. There is something wrong with this powder! Thankfully I felt better right after. On a side note this does not mix well at all. Even after vigorous whisking there are still MANY chunks left at the bottom of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Matcha
customer_reviews.text: I’m fairy new to making my own matcha Lattes and started with the Jade Leaf brand here on amazon because it had the most reviews and got good reviews. I wanted to try other brands as well so the Encha was next. It’s definitely a much brighter green than the Jade Leaf brand and has a slightly smoother flavor. Enough that I think it’s worth paying more for the Encha brand. From what I e read the brighter green it is the better? I could be wrong but I’ve seen some people mention that. Overall I’m very satisfied and will continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jones

customer_reviews.title: The best organic matcha I can find from Japan to US
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with matcha in my long vacation in Japan. But I didn't see any organic matcha in Japan. Back in the US, I see a bunch of them here. I tried four before, all had a brown tone and didn't have a smooth AND umami flavor. Encha is the fifth one I bought, trying their mini sample packet first. I opened the first one. Immediately the color looks better, a pure emerald green. Taste has the umami and complex flavor I loved and it's barely bitter. It took 5 buys to find one good organic matcha. The end of my story.
customer_reviews.author: Jiayan Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. I've tried a few different brands and I always come back to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Issabella

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I started drinking matcha approximately 10 years ago after visiting Japan. I tried many different matchas throughout the years. This one ranks among the top 5 that had tried. Has a great color, smooth taste, and smells great. It's definitely best enjoyed by itself instead of making a latte or using some other recipe. It's also priced fairly for being the ceremonial grade matcha. I would recommend trying it and I will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Problem?
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying a couple of different brands. I believe in just writing facts. With an hour of drinking for my glass (just matcha, water, ice) - my stomach was not well. I love Green Tea, but at that moment and for the next few hours, they thought of Green Tea made me nauseous. After reading a few reviews and some describing the same symptoms, I can't say for sure that that's what it is, but I will say rather than take a chance I trashed the remainder of the packet, and we'll go back to my other brand.
customer_reviews.author: The Hi Tech Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Quality & Affordability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item over other brands based on the Amazon reviews and YouTube videos from Encha, especially after watching the video of how they grow their “matcha” plant. It’s difficult to find a brand that is affordable yet doesn’t skimp on quality. People who think this particular brand is too expensive for 1 oz of organic ceremonial grade matcha (actually it’s a little more at 1.06 oz lol)... they just don’t get it. Anyway, this will be on my list to order again in the future. Currently, I have been using a blueberry lavender almond milk (with a squeeze of honey) and making matcha lattes. Yummy!
customer_reviews.author: IAMA10

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and less expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality matcha comparable to other organic ceremonial stone ground matcha that I have purchased. I discovered this brand after viewing their YouTube video about how to whisk matcha. I liked the video so I decided to try the product. It is less expensive than the other matcha and comes in a vacuum sealed pouch. I reuse the tins from my other matcha products to store the product after I open the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: LindaG Mama of Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Love this matcha green tea
customer_reviews.text: I began using Encha Matcha Green Tea (Ceremonial Grade) last year and this has been my go to tea that I order every month. I have tried other teas based on recommendations from friends but the quality does not stand up to Encha. I usually make a matcha green tea mixed with milk and agave to start my morning and the coloring on Encha is super fresh and green and mixes very well with milk. I gave up coffee a while go and rely on my daily green tea for energy to get me through the day and Encha has not disappointed. Priced at $20 I think it's a bargain for the quality and taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Matcha!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Matcha tea for a very long time but never found exactly the right one till now. This Matcha helps me to replicate the Matcha drinks I get from a Kyoto tea shop in NYC at a reasonable price. I love the fact also that it is organic which is very important to me. If you love Matcha I highly recommend this wonderful product! A++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Marli

customer_reviews.title: Great Matcha
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying Teavana matcha for years but started looking for another brand since the stores are closing, Encha matcha ceremonial tea is my new favorite. I saw it in a matcha review as the number one choice so I gave it a try. I was pleased when I opened the bag and saw a bright green matcha, I've learned that dull green inevitably means it'll be bitter. The taste was is so smooth. I highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Regal Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Matcha is great!
customer_reviews.text: I was glad I was watching Dr. Oz when an Asian lady wrote a book {which I purchased on Amazon}; she has great recipes fir using it fir more than a tea ritual. I drink 3 cups of hot green tea every day. It has so many benefits. I also watch Shayna Taylor on Shayna’s Kitchen; she makes lattes out of the matcha tea so I bought the appliance that makes lattes and it’s a different way of drinking it and it’s wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: sherian

customer_reviews.title: I keep trying to find better, but can't
customer_reviews.text: I love to have matcha daily, which is an expensive, but nutritious habit! I keep trying affordable, matcha brands hoping that I will find one as good as this. However, Encha's Latte, first harvest grade is refreshing and other brands I've tried that claim they are premium are muddy in comparison. If anyone can recommend another brand, I'm open to suggestions. However, Encha is my standard :)
customer_reviews.author: B. T.

customer_reviews.title: Catechins and EGCG
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 3rd packet of Ceremonial grade Encha Matcha and I love it. I originally purchased Encha for its truly amazing levels of healthy components--catechins and EGCG. I really appreciate Encha including the levels of Catechins and EGCG on their packaging. I also love the consistency of the tea. It is very easy to mix with hot water (unlike some other Matchas I've tried which are clumpy and need to be put though a strainer before adding to water). Thank you Encha for making a great Matcha!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Witz

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Encha
customer_reviews.text: Believe all of the 5 star reviews. This matcha powder has been tested for radiation, heavy metals, toxins, and pesticides. It's truly organic and I know this because whenever I drink other brands of matcha that have not been tested, my stomach tends to hurt and/or my teeth become more sensitive to the matcha. This matcha powder is delicious, flavorful, and light. The color is vibrant and young. Most importantly, I know that I am drinking the best type of matcha due to Encha's value in social responsibility. Honestly love this product, it's a bit expensive, but I think it's worth it if you drink it daily. THANK YOU, ENCHA!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality, taste and customer service. Simply the best ORGANIC MATCHA you can find.
customer_reviews.text: The color, oh the color! This is quite simply the purest, most delicious, gorgeous, indulgence! The bright green that you should see when you open a package of Matcha. The light organic flavor is beyond compare. I lived in Japan and was unable to find a comparable product here in the states until now. Encha Organic Matcha tea is the real deal. After purchasing and returning the dirt from other vendors, imitation matcha, I finally found Encha. I highly recommend this tea. You will not be disappointed. Superior quality. Fast shipping. Perfection. Makes a fantastic ceremonial tea or latte! No sugar needed for the latte!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Matcha! WOW!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This tea is amazing! Came packaged very nicely with an informative brochure and a sample single serve packet inside. I bought the 30gm size but have ordered a subscription for the larger size. I brought my tea packet to work and shared with my co-workers and they were amazed and loved it. They took pictures of the tea packaged so they could order. Whisks up with am amazing foam and the taste is incredible. I usually drink mine with just hot water. The color is gorgeous as you can see from the photos. I tried others but this brand won me over.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Green Hue.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first brand of powdered matcha that I purchased for use in lattes at home. I did not realize the quality of the product until my attempt to buy a different and less expensive powdered matcha. The color of this powder is artful in itself, and the taste is crisp. This, coupled with the focus, energy, and warmth provided from consuming it, deserves a large portion of the credit for another successful semester of school. This is my third or fourth time purchasing of this product, and I will continue to do so until the quality decreases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm picky and I Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a good made in Japan matcha brand in the US with reasonable price for so long, and this is it! Encha matcha tastes and smells amazing! I make my latte with oatmilk and a little bit of honey. This is he BEST matcha out there and the value is great. The bag looks small at first but lasts forever since they pack the powder in there unlike those tin cans where its very loosely pack and will run out in no time. HIGHLY RECOMMEND from a picky matcha lover!
customer_reviews.author: MNPT

customer_reviews.title: I usually love this matcha, but......
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this matcha 3 separate times, it is my absolute favorite and I have tried 5-6 different brands and quite picky. This one is amazing! It is fresh, has a vibrant color and a pleasant, mild taste. However I placed an order 2 days ago and received it today damaged!! The pouch holding the matcha had a huge hole and the precious matcha powder was all over the inside of amazon box. When I tried to return/exchange the product, Amazon told me this item was ineligible for returns! I love love love this company and have continued to support and buy from them but I am not happy with this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Saba Rizvi

customer_reviews.title: *FIVE STARS OUT OF FIVE* Exceptional Product, Excellent Service
customer_reviews.text: Upon learning of matcha and it's numerous health benefits, I decided to try several matcha brands; Encha is truly unparalleled in its commitment to an exceptional product and excellent service. The matcha is rich, flavorful, and fresh. And I have become reliant on its consistency and flavor paired with oat milk for the perfect, frothy oat matcha latte. As committed as they are to their customers, I will continue to buy the matcha on a routine basis as it has become part of the little things that make my days all the better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Matcha, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I worshipped coffee until I couldn't. The amount of caffeine was spinning me out and creating panic attacks so I gave it up, but missed "the routine." Enter matcha. It has half the amount of one cup of coffee but the L-theanine in it makes for a much mellower and prolonged focus. I've tried a few matcha brands, but keep coming back to Encha. Great quality and taste. They routinely offer a gratitude program for 15% off that is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic matcha! From the moment I opened it, I smelled the wonderful aroma instantly. Next, the coloring is great as well: the perfect bright green. When making it, the tea foamed up just as matcha should. Now, the important part: The flavor! It's fantastic. Wish I knew how to describe flavor notes. It's just a great tasting tea. I've found my new favorite matcha! I only wish it came in a jar rather than a pack, but I wont even remove a star for this. I'll just look for a small, dark, airtight jar to transfer it to.
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: Best Matcha tea I’ve ever had!! Keto perfect!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking at this then you’re already considering and know all the wonderful benefits to ceremonial green Matcha tea. This product is wonderful. It taste like a fresh picked cup of matcha. Quality is above and beyond. Some may think it’s expensive for the small amount but it takes an eighth of a teaspoon for one cup. All those benefits in such a small amount. I add a teaspoon of erythritol in mind since I like sweet. You must be used to having some type of green drink. It’s so beneficial and helps so much!! Great for my Keto lifestyle!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: the best Ceremonial Organic Matcha
customer_reviews.text: Iv'e tried 4 other Ceremonial grade matcha powders on here, all had over 1000+ reviews and this is by far the best quality. Don't waste your time with other brands. Smoothest, Most vibrant color, great umami, not bitter.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better for matcha latte!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been drinking matcha for about 3 years. I started by trying different brands, I liked them all in the beginning then eventually I got tired of the taste and kept looking for a better one. That was until I found Encha 2 years ago. I’ve been drinking it every single day (iced matcha latte, with cows milk and sugar) and just love the taste so much! It makes any other coffeeshop matcha taste blend in comparison. And also, most importantly it gives me the energy that I need to survive the day since I am always sleep deprived (kids!!)
customer_reviews.author: Katia

customer_reviews.title: Taste awesome/sad I can not afford to drink daily.
customer_reviews.text: I had never tried Matcha before. Then I went to Starbucks and tried the Matcha latte. Wow loved that so I purchased this to make my own. I was disappointed with the size. This was expensive for such a small pouch! But the taste and color and smell was heavenly! I made it and frothed my milk into it added a small amount of Splenda and it taste just like the SB one! I wish I could buy more but I can’t afford that much. I want to drink daily so that would be extremely expensive! But if u can buy it this is the perfect Matcha!
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: The Best Matcha EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best matcha I have ever had! I have tried many brands and this is the greenest, creamiest and best frothing matcha I've had. Some matches have a yellower tone, or a duller green color- this one is intensely green and tastes both fresh and slightly sweet. I drink it every morning instead of coffee now, and sometimes as a pick me up in the afternoon- it doesn't keep me up at night like coffee or black tea. It's much easier on the tummy than green tea for some reason, and I love the flavor. I drink the ceremonial grade. There are many Youtube videos to show you how to properly prepare it.
customer_reviews.author: sallybee5

customer_reviews.title: Amazing effect, so so taste
customer_reviews.text: This matcha is the most effective on giving me a sustained long hours of focus, energy and well being but it has the most so-so taste from all the rest i’ve tried, very bland and dull. By the way you don’t need to use 2 grams as they advertise as a serving, they want you to finish it fast, the others brands i tried tells you 1 gram and i find that enough on this one too
customer_reviews.author: Vabene

customer_reviews.title: YUMMY
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely delicious!!! As a newcomer to making matcha lattes- I was fretting over which matcha to buy (there are so many options and a lot of opinions to sift through)- it was a bit overwhelming. But I’m so thrilled that I landed on this one because it is absolutely delightful! The flavor is perfect. I was expecting to need to add some sweetener but it tasted so great with soy milk alone that I didn’t even need to! Highly highly recommend. I probably won’t even try other brands because why change a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: After all these years....THIS IS IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality matcha. Taste exactly like the ones I got from Kyoto. Vibrant green. Very easy to froth. The taste is sweet and soothing. If you are looking for authentic matcha, get this. I am very picky with my matcha because I drink it the original way so I need it to be high quality. For that I steer clear from the ones that are for baking or iced latte (im also very skeptical of products with those reviews).
customer_reviews.author: Minh Le

customer_reviews.title: Not pure macha and not all natural color
customer_reviews.text: Not pure macha. Color is SUPER bright green and after making tea, it is confirmed that both taste and color is added coloring green. I will NOT buy again from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aung Myo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lattes and on it's own
customer_reviews.text: This matcha is perfect on it's own and for lattes. I purchased it because ceremonial grade was too expensive to use in my latte, but the culinary grade matcha is gross. The flavor of this product is fresh, the color is bright green, and I have used it both in my lattes and on it's own with just water. My only recommendation is to sift it first (as I do with all matcha) before adding water, this really helps with any "clumping".
customer_reviews.author: M. Santa Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo Good!
customer_reviews.text: My sister got me started drinking matcha and she told me yours is the BEST! I drink at least one every day and it gives me such a good energy (not jittery like coffee) I just feel GOOD the rest of the day. I've gotten several coworkers started on it as well. Honey, mint extract, vanilla extract, cream, encha matcha and good crunchy ice is a wonderful drink! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had some really bad tasting matcha tea in the past so I was hesitant to try again, but had heard of all the great benefits of matcha powder. I really wanted to find an alternative to coffee because I am the type of person who gets jittery and the shakes if I have more than a cup. I was ecstatic to find this product and have been enjoying this every morning as my coffee alternative. :-) My favorite way to prepare it is with some coconut milk on ice and a little honey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent matcha
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite matcha product. It took awhile but I was finally able to order a pound of this stuff; it’s very pricey and they don’t seem to have it often but I keep the bag in the freezer, refilling matcha to the smaller jar I received on a previous purchase, which I go through in about two weeks. I keep the smaller jar in the refrigerator so it too remains fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Orcanator

customer_reviews.title: The best Matcha I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: I am a tea enthusiast and green tea is one of my favorites! A few years ago, I became interested in matcha, and while in the past I drank it as a tea, recently I started making matcha latte. I have used couple of famous matcha, and I should say so far Encha is the absolute winner! It has this bright green color and you can smell a pleasant grassy smell, as you start mixing it with boiled water. It tastes good no matter you use it as tea or mixing it with milk to make latte (I have tried both the ceremonial and latte version of Encha). I believe you would enjoy Encha if you are a matcha fan.
customer_reviews.author: Oracle13

customer_reviews.title: A MOST SATISFYING TRUE MATCHA TEA!!!
customer_reviews.text: After having overcome a lost or Mis- delivery, and finally receiving your product, ( now my tea) What a truly wonderful and delicious true Matcha Tea!!! Actually even exceeding my expectations!!! I really enjoyed this tea!! And will continue to enjoy it for a long time. From a truly satisfied customer, Thank You!!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID EARL ERVIN

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: My package came ripped open with matcha coming out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley C

customer_reviews.title: The best on amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different brands of matcha on Amazon and I have to say I have found one of the best. It is strong and after cutting the portion in half it turned out to be perfect. It have a smooth taste that is addictive which has helped my blood pressure. My doctor had to take me off my blood pressure medication because the last 2 times I went it was low which never happens to me. It has always been high until I started drinking this matcha. I am hoping that I can loose some weight on this stuff also. Fingers crossed 😀. Would definitely recommend to everyone and will definitely be back for more.
customer_reviews.author: kelly jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best ceremonial-grade matcha ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first matcha powder I have ever bought so I can't really compare to other ones out there, but after doing some extensive research and reading reviews I decided to go with this one. First of all, this mixes very well and froths up so nicely. Secondly, the powder is so fine and BRIGHT GREEN! It looks so pretty and looks high quality. And third, this tastes SO GOOD. It has an earthy green taste but is also sweet. I liked it so much I got a subscription (makes it cheaper)! You should too, you won't be disappointed :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Latte or ceremonial?
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many Matcha brands and I keep coming back to Encha, I recently order the latte mini samples, lol...(since I spend a fortune on the ceremonial), and let me say that since I use the same ingredients to sweeten it, I can’t tell the difference. So I will save my 45.00 ceremonial for special days and continue using the latte 1st harvest for now. For those that feel a little worried or can’t seem to decide which one will work for them, I say buy the mini sample and you get 8 little one spoon samplers in a small box of 6. Yes ..... you receive two free extras in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t dissolve well
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a matcha expert but I am a long time, every day matcha drinker. I’ve never had trouble dissolving any matcha until I tried Encha. This matcha was all clumps. I used the same process and the same whisk that I always use. I had to whisk harder and for a longer time but I still had clumps everywhere. I even tried using a blender bottle and shook that thing until I couldn’t shake anymore. Still clumpy. It made for a very unpleasant drinking experience every single time. I kept drinking it only because I spent a lot of money on it. I will not be purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jos

customer_reviews.title: Just Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and delicious! I've made lattes, smoothies, and frozen coconut cream-based desserts with this - all of them were amazing! A little goes a long way. I emptied the bag into a small, airtight, glass jar to make it easier for me to measure out a teaspoon at a time and not spill. It's works great - just make sure the jar is clean and very dry before you put the product in there. I would like to add though, that I like the way this product is packaged - since it needs to ship, I appreciate the lightweight, but airtight and sealed packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie G.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best and most economical ceremonial matcha powders on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have to date tried over a dozen ceremonial grade matcha products in the past 5+ years. Like coffee and tea one’s personal taste always comes into play. However, this product over the past 5 or 6 purchases remains one of my favorites. It is brighter than my pictures. It is a more fresh or green flavor than some of the others but don’t get me wrong almost all of the ceremonial grade 1oz products I have tried were good. This one is just a few dollars less expensive than some of the others. I also feel the packaging is more eco friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Lee

customer_reviews.title: Color and Taste
customer_reviews.text: The color is a good deep green and it is the best tasting matcha I've had so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: You definitely pay for quality
customer_reviews.text: After searching the Internet for the best green tea matcha I went with this brand and it was a winner.. I didn’t realize all of the aspects to consider when making a choice, this one is bright green and smooth. I will say I had bought a different brand before and tasted like dirt
customer_reviews.author: Makaili Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Simple Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I do believe so far this is the best Matcha I have had - I enjoy it more than even Teavana's. Extremely fine and easy to blend (I do make a paste instead of using straight away, then add to my water (regular Matcha - dark green in the cup pic ) or milk (Match latte - light green in the cup pic). Also, I started using the HadinEEon Milk Frother/Heater that I found here on Amazon). Definitely a staple for my Bulletproof Matcha Lattes now!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Collins (& occasionally Hubs)

customer_reviews.title: Quality affordable and lasts long
customer_reviews.text: A great rich matcha powder I haven’t used it to bake with just in my morning matcha lattes :) I absolutely love this brand’s affordability and the smooth richness of the tea. Tastes like some expensive brands I’ve tried beforehand. Blends perfectly! I got the latte grade :)
customer_reviews.author: Fawn

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful green color, lovely flavor, foams easily
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely gorgeous and delicious tea! It is a lovely bright green, foams easily, and tastes like a dream! At first, I was surprised that the package was so small, but after some additional research learned that ceremonial grade matcha tea is very expensive and this brand is actually very competitively priced. I will definitely order again and highly recommend. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jezebel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Super grassy and bright green! Strong flavor, even a 1/2tsp could suffice or you could add more water. I use 1tsp with 8oz water (make 3-4oz of the 8oz hot water & shake), some ice and 2-4tbs sugar free vanilla or sugar free hazelnut syrup- SUPER DELICIOUS. Waiting to try with almond or coconut milk, and even in a smoothie! Well worth the price. Perfect for morning or midday pick me up. YUMMMM.
customer_reviews.author: Verified user

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: The color is beautiful. The flavor has that clean matcha kick that I like, with a nutty under flavor. Its a beautiful blend. I purchased the latte grade. I have not tried it tea style yet but this makes really good lattes. Whisk the milk in a little at a time. It could blend just a little better. Make sure you use your sifter. I am very happy with this brand. If your like me your matcha is the best part of your day. I will most deffinitly repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mysticashes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know it was good until I had worse.
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly new to drinking matcha. I needed something to keep me awake for a little during finals week so coffee was out of the question. I didn't know what this bitter taste people were saying about bad quality matcha. To me, this matcha had a bitter taste at first. I wanted to try other brands so I bought a "ceremonial grade matcha" can at a nearby grocery store. I say ceremonial grade in quotations because that brand tasted straight up bitter. I now know this brand is amazing color wise and taste wise. I will never try another brand from Sprouts grocery store again.
customer_reviews.author: Wynne

customer_reviews.title: Best matcha powder and great value!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this matcha powder! My husband and I are huge tea consumers. This tea is so pure, which is evident from the color. It gives us lasting energy with absolutely no crash. The taste is so smooth, as well, and not "gritty". I love that it is pure with no additives, because you can make it however you'd like. Best matcha powder, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: kamisha

customer_reviews.title: Healthful and will give you more boost than coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have a tall cup of matcha at least once a day. This brand works for me, although I’m not a matcha connoisseur. I order this via auto ship so I never run out. Matcha definitely gives me more energy than coffee, plus it has other great health benefits.
customer_reviews.author: SocalDancer

customer_reviews.title: superior quality from farm to cup + great value
customer_reviews.text: SUPERIOR QUALITY from the farm to cup... and everything in between. 1st harvest means smooth and creamy (no bitterness), organic farming practice is always a bonus, packaging preserves the freshness, founder (Li) actually cares about his farmers in Japan (which I found out in when inquiring about his matcha grades - for which he was VERY responsive). GREAT VALUE = quality at a fair price. I was making my morning matcha with a much more expensive brand (more than double Encha's $) until I discovered Encha, courtesy of a friend. After tasting Encha's ceremonial grade and talking with Li, I was a convert!
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: My new green latte in office!!
customer_reviews.text: I successfully replaced office cappuccino with organic matcha latte that is beautifully green, tasty and gives me good energy and focus to pull through my afternoon of work. And no crash at the end of day!! I put 1 spoon of Encha matcha powder and mix it vigorously with a bit hot water in my mug. And then pour foamed milk from my office's cappuccino machine. Quite fun to mix it. Now everyone is jealous of my green latte, hooray!
customer_reviews.author: Ming Chen

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a matcha aficionado
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried three kinds of matcha over the past five years or so since first discovering matcha, and I only drink it as tea (haven't tried it in smoothies, baking, etc.), but this is so far my favorite. It's a small packet, but I only drink it twice a week or so, and it's been lasting me awhile now. It seems to be the smoothest I've tried. I drink it with a little honey and a lot of frothed almond milk, and it's a fabulous treat (and keeps me awake for a full day's work).
customer_reviews.author: Geeshie Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Decent Matcha
customer_reviews.text: Not amazing, and not disappointing. This Matcha has an even consistency. It has a great deep "fresh" green color. It taste great. It's good Match. Not amazing matcha, but good matcha. The price is pretty much what I would expect to pay for 30g. Edit: When purchasing the 60g package, I did not receive it in a fancy box like I did with the 30g package. It's not a huge deal, but I did want to see that extra packaging
customer_reviews.author: Joseph s

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Is this a joke? There’s no chance there’s 15 (1tsp) servings in this $20 bag of matcha. MAYBE you can eek out 5... This is absurd
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: This matcha powder was definitely good. You can tell it's high quality and it does have that bright green color you want to see in high-quality matcha. It is a little more on the expensive side, but it's definitely worth it. I would definitely purchase again if Jade's Matcha is sold out. I do like the flavor better with the Jade Leaf matcha powder as this encha brand leaves a little bit of an unpleasant aftertaste. It's not the prevalent, so it may not be a big deal to most. It is definitely comparable with other high-quality matcha brands.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality! Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Flavorful, smooth, and a beautiful bright green. Perfect for making lattes, ice cream, and lemonade. So much better than the typical cheap matcha that is oh, so disappointing (chalky, bitter, astringent?, and greyish in color). I'm very pleased with the quality of this product. Will buy again, for sure. Disclaimer: I don't typically drink matcha prepared the traditional way with just hot water, so I can't speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: L.Ch.

customer_reviews.title: Delicate yet robust
customer_reviews.text: Recently got hooked on matcha lattes, so I thought I’d try my hand at making them at home, since they’re pretty scarce around my area. This has a superb, delicate yet robust matcha flavor, and the powder is a beautiful bright green color. Whips up really nicely with a chasen. Definitely worlds better than some domestic brands I’ve tried! Also appreciate Encha’s story and mission, and that this product is organic. Looking forward to my next purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ashe G

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ❤️ the Encha flavor and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing matcha green tea! I will always order the Encha brand. There isn’t any bitterness. A delicious smooth and grassy flavor. I start every morning off with an Encha matcha green tea latte. I feel calm yet energized and less hungry. Sometimes I will have a cup in the afternoon to curb afternoon snacking (prepared with water using a bamboo whisk). The latte grade is so good I can’t imagine how enjoyable my afternoon tea will be when I purchase the ceremonial grade. The color is a vibrant green. Replaced my heavy, muddy morning coffee latte which I used to think was delicious 🤷🏻‍♀️ I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Matcha powder quality is great, good, very disappointed by packet size
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many Matcha powders by now, and seen their quality and effects. The best one is Nana's green tea, Mizuba tea co. But since I had to order something from Amazon for filler, I tried Encha based on the ratings. It is a pure ceremonial tea and blends well and gives a good color and froth, it is strong too. Quality is great. However, I was disappointed by how tiny the packet size is! I did not think that it is even 30 grams.
customer_reviews.author: shubham saloni

customer_reviews.title: Mixes very well! Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small shaker bottle for this, never having used matcha before. I put 1 teaspoon of matcha into the shaker bottle with cold water, shake, then add some local honey and almond milk. Makes an awesome, smooth, lumpless matcha latte. I'm sure it would blend with hot water too, but I like cold lattes. Switched from cold brew coffee a few weeks back, for the health benefits, and I'll never look back!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Smooth & delicious
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other matchas and they don’t blend and taste as smooth as Encha’s plus the flavor is excellent. I was looking for a matcha specifically for matcha lattes and this matcha is perfect! I do advise following the farms instructions to blend the matcha with hot water first then add your milk or you will end up with little matcha chunks even with a batrrry powered whisk! I also must mention their customer service is excellent. Looking forward to trying it iced soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Indulgent
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after reading a comparison article somewhere a few years ago and I agree it surpasses the handful of competitors I’ve tried. Great value, comparatively (especially with subscription).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying matcha and I have to say I was very pleased with the delicate taste. The matcha was not bitter and it did not leave me with a nasty after taste. It was a green taste..very earthy and delicious. I can definitely feel the zenergy. I don’t feel hyper, but I’m more alert. I would definitely purchase again. I think that for the quality and the size it is definitely a great deal! There’s not a lot of sellers that have proof of the radiation levels being 0. The seller is very open and honest and I would repurchase for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Pricila Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Now that I've had this Matcha - I will never buy another brand!
customer_reviews.text: I only use 1/2 teaspoon in a whole mug and it is so fresh and beautifully fragrant and delicious. The ones that I bought at Whole Foods and health food stores taste like stale grass clippings in comparison. I now travel with a little container with me so I never have to suffer through a bad cup of matcha again.
customer_reviews.author: Sensible Mystic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Matcha
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this wonderful Matcha Tea. I've never had the latte kind before and am really enjoying it. It blends quite easily in my shaker container with cold water first, then my milk of choice, coconut milk. The videos on the Encha website are quite interesting too! Knowing a bit about the background makes the whole experience even more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Paula R

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the flavor, the color, the blending power in cold and hot liquids = best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: My family orders daily from Amazon, but it's rare we leave a review on our purchases. But I had to write one for this matcha! Hands down the flavor, the color, the freshness, the blending power in cold and hot liquids is the best of the best. I drink matcha daily and it's hard to find one with ten points for every category. This definitely is a ten across the board. Stop your search and buy this one, I promise you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bporter

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for a reason
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many matcha brands and this one is the best. Rule of thumb - an expensive Ceremonial Matcha tea which is expensive is always the best quality. This one is so smooth, not bitter at all so I didn't need to add milk or any sweetener.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena K

customer_reviews.title: Best matcha I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I've been drinking matcha for almost 2 years now and I must say this is the best matcha I've ever had. It's super smooth and has a vibrant green color. Tastes absolutely amazing. I can't start my morning without a hot cup of matcha from Encha. I have both ceremonial grade and the latte grade and they're both absolutely delicious. If you haven't tried this matcha yet, you don't know what you're missing out.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Reviewed Matcha
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best matcha I have tasted or seen. Color grassy bright, taste uplifting and fresh. Benefits, it gives me a lift in the morning that last, study yet calm, with no drastic drop down. Organic highly recommended, no need to add sugar.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for organic ceremonial matcha
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this matcha for the past few weeks and it is my favorite organic ceremonial grade matcha. The package came exactly as it is pictured; with the box, the information pamphlet, a sample of the matcha latte and the matcha itself in the 1 oz bag. I do wish the matcha came on a tin container like most other matcha powders but for the price I don't really mind. The bag it comes in is actually thick to keep the light out. I suggest keeping it in the fridge to maintain freshness.
customer_reviews.author: Jaileen

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I got hooked on the Starbucks matcha lattes and hadn't found an equivalent product until now. This matcha package looked tiny on arrival, like a matcha pouch for ants. However, a mere teaspoon of this stuff will have your milk looking greener than the hulk and tasting grassier than the pristine hills of Japan that your hipster self has yet to visit.
customer_reviews.author: AAK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product and Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: My wife grew up in a multicultural family and her career had taken her to various parts of the world. She always appreciates and goes for the best quality tea she can find around the globe. By far, Encha ceremonial grade tea is a her favorite and we have been ordering 2 to 4 packages the 60g package several times a month. We did experience a packing issue through Amazon but Encha provided excellent customer service and expeditiously sent a replacement package, which we appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and color. Mixes well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent matcha the tase is clean and not bitter at all. The powder mixes very well. The price is good. But since I drink it everyday (it replaces my coffee) it tends to be more on the expensive side. Still on the lookout for a daily matcha that I can blend with half n half and drink in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: AmmuChip

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor, blends well
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other matcha brands, some more expensive, and so far, this is my favorite brand. Appreciate how it is organic. Pricing seems fair. The color is a very vibrant green. The portion size lasts a long time . Taste does not taste bitter. Has a subtle sweet undertone, And neutral “grassy” if drunk alone. I use an electric frother, and it blends wonderfully. No large clumps. Sediment can sink to the bottom as time passes, but a quick stir again will mix it up back to smoothness. I will continue to buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Seems excellent for organic matcha
customer_reviews.text: Seems excellent to me, but I’m new to matcha. I have since learned that there is better matcha available that is NOT organic, having to do with elevation differences/requirements. Look it up.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW PERETZ

customer_reviews.title: Best Matcha in the Market
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Encha! I use to be afraid to try matcha because it would have a grassy taste but after my sister recommended Encha for me to try, I became hooked. The flavor is so mild and after doing some research I found out that high quality matcha had a smooth taste and the cheaper ones have the grassy taste. Encha is definitely high quality tea, it’s also tested for radioactivity, which mean you only get the benefits and antioxidants from the tea not all the junk that’s in other matchas.
customer_reviews.author: Bhavin

customer_reviews.title: The flavor is tasty!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tea, I started to drink Matcha before and I felt no very satisfied with the flavor even in good café stores, but I kept buying because is healthy and have a lot of benefits. I have 2 week drinking this specific brand and I really love it for the flavor, is super tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Mayreli Cuevas.

customer_reviews.title: Would order again.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this matcha. I drink match everyday instead of coffee due to my anxiety. It keeps me awake and calm at the same time. This was my first time trying this brand. It Blends and taste well. It does have a slight wasabi taste, but it didn’t bother me. I like the differences matcha’s can have. It was a good change from my previous matcha. The color was a good bright green and the matcha kept fresh. I used the bag in just about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Sang

customer_reviews.title: I have been sampling a lot of brands over the last couple of months and Encha is by far the best that I've tasted so far
customer_reviews.text: I am not a huge Matcha fan, but I drink it for the health benefits. I have been sampling a lot of brands over the last couple of months and Encha is by far the best that I've tasted so far. It has a beautiful color, not too bitter, and no fishy smell like some others. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Angela B.

customer_reviews.title: Not chalky! Addictive Matcha
customer_reviews.text: This matcha is seriously the best I have ever tried. Honestly when the package came in the mail I was not impressed because of how small it was for the price. But once I made myself a cup I was hooked. This first harvest, ceremonial grade matcha is the most beautiful, rich in color. It’s sweet and creamy not chalky and dull. I have been drinking at least 2 cups a day . Im really impressed and will be buying more soon because I’m running out.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Great product and prior reviewers have said it all. Just wanted to add that I was able to use it for 45 servings (cup sized lattes). Making the cost $0.58 per serving. I paid $25.95 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H

product_meta.title: Encha Ceremonial Organic Matcha (USDA Organic Certificate and Antioxidant Content Listed, Premium First Harvest Directly from Farm in Uji, Japan, 30g/1.06oz in Resealable Pouch)
feature_bullets: Ceremonial grade Encha is the premium first-harvest organic matcha green tea powder, ground from the most tender leaves each spring on our farm in the Uji mountains of Kyoto, Japan.
All Encha matcha is USDA certified organic. The organic certificate, the report of no radioactivity, the matcha nutrition content, and our matcha farm video are in the last three images.

100% Money Back Guarantee: Customer enjoyment of Encha is the reason for our organic matcha farming. In case you are not satisfied with your order, please contact us for refund. Amazon return policy doesn't accept returns of grocery products including matcha. But we can issue you a returnless refund. You can contact us by clicking "Sold by Encha" and then “Ask a question”.
Whisk vigorously Encha ceremonial matcha powder with 5oz hot water at 160°F in a matcha bowl. Enjoy its smooth, full-bodied and delicately grassy taste.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
